results.title: Introduction to sound
results.brief_description: Gives examples of the diferent types of sound explaining how all such sounds are produced by a vibrating source. Explains the meaning of the terms oscillation, amplitude and frequency. Animated diagrams are used to show how the human vocal mechanism functions and models are used to demonstrate and explain the functioning of the human ear.

results.title: Introduction to reaction kinetics
results.brief_description: Illustrates by animation the mechanisms of some simple chemical reactions. Explains the effect of temperature, activation energy, geometry of collision, and catalysis upon the rate of reaction.

results.title: Introduction to preventive maintenance
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
Shows the importance of preventive maintenance in truck operation and illustrates a typical preventive maintenance check as applied to the clutch pedal, the battery and the voltage regulator.

results.title: Introduction to prestressed concrete
results.brief_description: Prestressing, by the introduction of steel bars or cables under high tension into liquid concrete, has revolutionised concrete construction. Shows the difference between pre-tensioning and post-tensioning, and production techniques in the factory and on the site.

results.title: Introduction to physics
results.brief_description: Shows a narrator describing various aspects of physics including the main divisions of the subject, the distinguishing features of each division, and the everyday application of the principles of physics.

results.title: Introduction to Personal Computers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videologic Computer Training Series”.
Aimed at the novice who wants to get started in the world of personal computers. Learn about the origin of the PC, the components that make up a computer system and how it can be used in the home or the office. This video offers a clear understanding of the hows and whys of the computer revolution. A reference booklet comes with the video.

results.title: Introduction to Orchestra!: Upper strings. Woodwind
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Hewes, Declan Lowney and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series provides an introduction to the methods and objectives of the series. It also examines the role of the the upper string instruments, violin and viola and the early work of Bach and Handel. It also examines the woodwind section focussing on the oboe and the use of a double reed.

results.title: Introduction to optics
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom and Educational Services Incorporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Elbert P. Little discusses the approximation that light travels in a straight line and demonstrates how its direction is changed by diffraction, scattering, refraction and reflection. Suitable for upper secondary level.
